title: Use dependabot to keep GitHub Actions updated

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

body:
### Description of the feature request:


Hey, it's Pedro (see #20087) and I'm back with another security suggestion. Once again, sorry for not following the template, this didn't really fit in one...

Bazel already hash-pins it's GitHub Actions (done in #18264), which is great. However, hashes are hard to update manually, so we could use dependabot to do this work automatically.

We can set up dependabot to send a single periodic PR to update all the hashes. This will help keep bazel's CI up-to-date.

If you'd rather keep the Actions fixed at these trusted versions, I'd suggest enabling Dependabot security updates (if you haven't already â€“ that information isn't visible from outside). These are PRs sent by Dependabot whenever a vulnerability is reported on a dependency. This will ensure that, should a vulnerability be discovered in the hash-pinned version of an Action, Bazel will immediately receive a PR to migrate to a patched version. To enable security updates:

1. Settings > [Code security & analysis](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/settings/security_analysis)
2. Enable "Dependabot security updates"

In the meantime, I'll send a PR adding dependabot so you can take a look.
